website_summaries.verdict: These pads are soaked in a non-irritating solution and can be used to clean both in and around the eye. Works for general eye irritation and stains.
pros: Pre soaked pads are fantastically convenient
Gentle formula cleans without stinging and relieves general eye irritation
Takes care of dirt and infection-causing bacteria
Most dogs don’t seem mind these pads and show no signs of discomfort during cleaning
Twist off cap ensures that wipes stay moist
cons: Pads are somewhat small and thin
Getting a single wipe out can be tricky

customer_reviews.title: Oscar gets really bad infections around his right eye
customer_reviews.text: Oscar gets really bad infections around his right eye, it causes his whole area to get red and crusted up. We tried this and it worked great! Even after the first use we could see a big difference. I don't use it as directed, maybe once a day but it still works great. Will absolutely buy again. P.S. forgive the before pic, he was helping me size baby hats I was making. No cats were tortured m, he just acts like he was.
customer_reviews.author: April Mcleod

customer_reviews.title: ... burn on the inside of the lid which smelled horrible. Then upon lifting the very weak silver seal
customer_reviews.text: Package came with a burn on the inside of the lid which smelled horrible. Then upon lifting the very weak silver seal, I found what looked like to splinters inside the package on top of these "sterile" pads. I've never written a review before, but this warranted a one. Please be careful before you buy, these are going nowhere near my cat's eyes. Refund pending and these are going in the trash. I know that's harsh, but this is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Vienna Celeste

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Bought originally for my two toy poodles, when I first opened the silver seal was weak and the lid was burt. I complained to Amazon and was sent a second one and the same thing happened again. Will not be putting this around my two dogs face.
customer_reviews.author: Laura P. Uribe

customer_reviews.title: Have been using this product for 6 years for my ...
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this product for 6 years for my dog. She let's me clean her eyes which tend to get a dry crust from time to time. It has never had any adverse side effects.
customer_reviews.author: Lindali

customer_reviews.title: Love these pads
customer_reviews.text: Being the parent of three Yorkies and one Shih Tzu; cleaning their eyes is a constant concern. Using these pads has significantly reduced the daily buildup of dried tears and mucus. I will keep these on hand at all times now. It's a shame this is not a subscription item. The only "problem" I have is getting just one pad out at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Rice75013

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied and disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The silver foil seal was unsealed, there were less than a third of the pads in the tub, there was staining on the inside of the cap and the few pads in the tub were disturbed and the top one dirty. They are obviously used. Throwing them in the garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My cat occasionally has conjunctivitis. I’ve tried drops and washes. She hates both and runs if she sees me getting out the bottles. She didn’t mind me using these and sits on my lap while I wipe her eyes. Her eyes cleared up in a few days. These are also more sanitary than a cotton ball I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Esha

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product but.....
customer_reviews.text: I really love this product and it really works on my dog. It’s the only thing damp he will allow near his eyes. However, I didn’t give it 5 stars because when I opened the lid to the container, the seal that keeps it moist and contained was already peeled back. A few of them were dried out and a few missing. It was like someone bought these and returned them, but amazon just put them back on the shelf without checking it out!
customer_reviews.author: D. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: They smelled so bad I just threw them away
customer_reviews.text: When I received my eye wash pads the seal was broken under the lid. they were alldried up and had a rusty red color to them. They smelled so bad I just threw them away. At the price it was more of hassle to send them back. MY LOSS.
customer_reviews.author: S.D.M.

customer_reviews.title: pleasant for the dog
customer_reviews.text: My little dog has eye allergies, dust is a big problem and I have to keep his eyes really clean. These work great for easy, frequent cleaning. It must be pleasant for him, because he doesn't resist and his eyes stay much cleaner and less irritated. They are VERY thin and stick together, so to get the most out of the 90 wipes, carefully peel them apart, otherwise, it's easy to use 3-5 at a time.
customer_reviews.author: ReindeerGames

customer_reviews.title: arrived with seal open and product only filled 25% of jar
customer_reviews.text: The lid was loose. When I lifted it off, I noticed the silver foil that covers/ is supposed to seal the product was open. The product was not dried out, interestingly. The jar was about 25% full. Can't count the pads, but definitely there was a problem with this product. Can't believe they sent me something used, but not sure what other explanation there is.
customer_reviews.author: 40ish Professional

customer_reviews.title: Major Rip Off
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT worth the money; I feel like someone took $8.44 from me. Every time I've used them they get nothing off of my poodle's eyes, nor do they even loosen up the gunk. They are not easy to use because they are so thin, you spend more time trying to get out only one and if you should grab 2 or more you're spending time trying to put them back in the bottle flat so they don't dry out. I found it better and easier to use a warm washcloth. I had hoped this would eliminate the need for the washcloth, however, it does not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Came opened
customer_reviews.text: Have no idea if will work it came in top opened pads inside sitting on their side had dry feeling i'm sure they should have been moist so disgusted I threw them in the garbage no way i would have attempted to even try putting them on or near our cat's eyes she is 22 yrs. old last thing now is to hurt her in anyway i know i should have returned them but just plain to upset and don't have time playing games i guess i should have believed some of the reviews that claimed the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: John C Neal II

customer_reviews.title: Handy little wipes
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff, removed brown coloration around eyes of my pure white Maltese. My dog does not like it. When he sees me reaching to the jar he disappears.
customer_reviews.author: Yurinomusume

customer_reviews.title: My Lil' Shih tzu, Waffles, likes it!
customer_reviews.text: My cute fur baby 'WAFFLES' likes it! I use this to keep her eyes clean from debris. She loves to run around and get dirty, so I like to use it after she is done playing. It definitely works, I see all the dirt it removes from her eye area. She doesn't seem to mind it and it doesn't irritate her eyes. The pads are thin, but I doesn't bother me because I just need a quick swipe and it seems to do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: JBshopper

customer_reviews.title: Work well, new branding possibly slightly less effective
customer_reviews.text: I had gotten some of this same brand a few months ago and it really helped; my dog has really stinky eyes/eye booger things, and these worked wonders. When I reordered, it had slightly different branding (even though it was the same posting) and I don't think they work quite as well. Better than nothing or just paper towels and warm water/soap/etc. that I had been using, that's for sure, but I was a little disappointed the second time around. Or maybe I'm just crazy and they're exactly the same.
customer_reviews.author: Lex D

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Lil Petunia was getting goop in her left eye almost weekly & these pads are so more convenient than using a cotton ball & bottle of liquid. Stuff works. Turns out kitty had oral herpes infection, & not only needed steroids but antibiotics, so no more goop. Have these handy just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Gringo A La Carte

customer_reviews.title: Very low quality product
customer_reviews.text: The first container came with a broken lid, yet it was still inside its plastic wrap. Amazon replaced it for free. However this is a very low quality product. The sheets are extremely thin and they do not retain enough moisture. I will not buy this product again. Total waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. I just grabbed a couple of the circles and wiped under my dogs eyes. They usually fight me because I try to sneak up on them with a wet washcloth. But these are small and compact but they really help.
customer_reviews.author: BellaSmile

customer_reviews.title: Good to get the crusties out
customer_reviews.text: We have two dogs that have Shih Tzu in them and with their eyes often get crusty or eye buggies. I have looked for something that is soft but also will be sensitive to their eyes. These seemed to do the job well but the only issue is that they are very thin and sometimes you have to pull them apart or you may get two at a time. Otherwise - you can use one for both eyes as long as their is no infection in them and must use a different pad for cleaning out and sanitary reasons. I will get these again for our dogs! :)
customer_reviews.author: Closetothebroken

customer_reviews.title: From our family of 4 white poodles: it is the best cleaner product
customer_reviews.text: We had tried a lot of product since 2008, and finally we got the one we love. It works! And what we like the best is that the pad is to be apply over the ey, softly, to clean and refresh the eye, and also works fantastic to clean around the eye. The dogs like it, and appeared to be enjoy the process of being clean. It removes debris inside the eye with out stressing you or your dog, and removes all the "crispy staff" around the eyes. Clean Faces, beautiful eyes, happy doguies... Right? This product works.
customer_reviews.author: Julie&Eillen

customer_reviews.title: Received an open and used container.
customer_reviews.text: Opened the package and noted that the seal was half torn off and some of the pads had obviously been used. Threw it away. SAD to see.
customer_reviews.author: Penny L. Bloodhart

customer_reviews.title: These work for my dog!
customer_reviews.text: My dog has one eye with white fur, and one with gray fur. Both eyes tear, but only the white one shows the stains. I've been through so many products that really don't do anything better than water. This one contains borac acid, and that seems to be the one thing that actually does work on my dogs stains. I use a flea comb to come out the gunk, and use these wipes every day, and the stains are minimal. They are VERY thin compared to other eye wipes, but that's my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Kara Cordero

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kitten that had an eye infection when she was 2 weeks old and her left eye is constantly tearing. It helps to remove the crust and seems to help the tearing. Only negative is pulling the pads apart but they really are moist and work well.
customer_reviews.author: JKCR

customer_reviews.title: Cleans well
customer_reviews.text: These clean well, but they could be a little thicker and bigger in diameter to clean my bulldog's eyes. Seems like I need to use several to get my dog's eyes cleaned up. They don't seem to irritate my bulldog's eyes, though, which is good.
customer_reviews.author: klang

customer_reviews.title: General Eye Wash May be more Effective
customer_reviews.text: I tried these thinking they would be easier to use than an eye wash. There doesn't seem to be very much 'solution' in each wipe leaving really nothing to 'squeeze' into the eye as directed. They definitely are convenient and easy to apply. I will use these up but doubtful I will reorder.
customer_reviews.author: Bev W

customer_reviews.title: I was told to use a product like this with a flee comb to get the eye ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a white dog, that is maltese mix and it really helps with cleaning his eyes, I was told to use a product like this with a flee comb to get the eye gunk out, I keep it up weekly as it wont get out of hand and my dog doesn't mind, I really get most of it clean before I use the comb to get out what wont come up with just the pad, best thing a vet ever taught me about cleaning dogs eyes that gunk up like my breed of dog.
customer_reviews.author: glorygirl

customer_reviews.title: A definite 5 star product.
customer_reviews.text: Look at the pictures, the one is after a few days of using these eye pads and the other picture is before we started using them. This product is awesome. I only use a half of pad in each she once a day. And she doesn't mind my wiping her eyes with them!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: My dog didn
customer_reviews.text: Tried this product because my dog suffers from dry eyes. However, my dog does not like me to clean his eye with this product. He prefers for me to use eye rinse and a soft towel to clean his eyes instead. It might irritate his eyes, but I am not sure. Still, decided not to purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Esmeralda Juarez

customer_reviews.title: I felt like I clean my bulldog's eyes with my naked finger
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculously small and thin! I felt like I clean my bulldog's eyes with my naked finger. I would not recommend to buy these.
customer_reviews.author: TigerMom

customer_reviews.title: Seal already open when it arrived
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived today and when I removed the lid, the silver seal was already open. The wipes are half the container and barely damp. Definitely not enough dampness to squeeze any liquid out of it based on the directions in the container. This seems to be what other reviewers complained about. I‘m still undecided if I will risk using the product or not. I’ll update this review later.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Simon

customer_reviews.title: I use these pads on my little 8 pound poodle/shitzu ...
customer_reviews.text: I use these pads on my little 8 pound poodle/shitzu "princess" who tends to be brown stains under her eyes. It does not complete remove the stains, but they do a find job of loosening up and cleaning dried on materials from around her eyes and generally making her more presentable.
customer_reviews.author: upnorthfan

customer_reviews.title: FYI: if you're looking for a tear stain remover this is not it !
customer_reviews.text: FYI: If You are looking for a tear stain remover this is not it. Buyer pay attention ! I thought I was getting a tear stain remover because that was the search criteria I put in the search field . To my surprise it is an eye wash . I personally think that washing with a warm cloth with warm water every day would be just as good and a lot less expensive. The product says to use a pad three or four times a day . To me $10 for these tiny little pads is not worth it . That is just my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: BullDog

customer_reviews.title: Works fast!
customer_reviews.text: My Teddy Bear pup has had the worst allergies this year causing his eyes to become irritated, red, itchy and even sometimes swollen. I used these pads last night on his eye that was swollen shut from irritation. This morning his eye was wide open, no longer swollen, and almost 100% back to normal. Just a little bit of redness left. I wish I'd have known about these sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Rayanna Longsine

customer_reviews.title: Don’t order these
customer_reviews.text: I thought this product was great, but if you don’t use them right away they mold. This changes the whole sterile description to an eye infection waiting to happen. Money down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing stuff
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe how well this worked. My cat has had issues with his eyelid swelling and funk forming in the corners of his eye. I bought this as a last resort because nothing seemed to be working. His eye cleared up within two days of using this. It’s amazing! Now if it starts to get funky again I just use this and it’s cleared up by the next day!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Ferrante

customer_reviews.title: Gentle Eye Wash, Removes Stains
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff for keeping my 3 Persian cats eyes and faces clean. I squirt it on a cotton make up pad and wipe their eyes/nose area twice a day. It removes the gunk and the tear stains and the odor those stains cause. I just wish it came in a bigger bottle since I can use this one up in about a week with 3 cats. My cats don't mind this stuff at all so it must not sting or burn their eyes. When I was using tap water, they would run away when I got the cotton pads out. Now one of my cats sits and waits for his eye cleaning and enjoys it :)
customer_reviews.author: C. Schellhorn

customer_reviews.title: Good Eye wash pads
customer_reviews.text: These eye pads smell weird. The inside of my jar lid was burnt partially brown/black when it arrived so that could attribute to the smell. However, my dog likes to have his eyes cleaned with these. It must feel good to him. He has allergies and these are soothing.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha King

customer_reviews.title: Not for pet rats
customer_reviews.text: Rats frequently have eye issues and it's good to have something to clean their eyes. This may be good for larger animals but for rats, after a couple of days, seems to be painful. Soft cloth and water works best for smaller animals.
customer_reviews.author: Susu

customer_reviews.title: Product leaked.
customer_reviews.text: The product was leaking when it arrived, so likely the pads will dry out before the last ones are used. The lid was a bit loose. It leaked over another item, so the package contents were a bit messy. I have used this product to clean my dog's eyes in the past; it is quite satisfactory and would otherwise get five stars.
customer_reviews.author: KayMac

customer_reviews.title: Safe for the amateur cat tamer.
customer_reviews.text: My cat was reluctant to trust me coming near her eye with these pads at first, but once she realized it wasn't going to hurt, she got used to our routine. They work great. Soft and gentle and easy for any rookie to handle on just about any remotely approachable cat. Safe for the amateur cat tamer.
customer_reviews.author: Heather David

customer_reviews.title: Terrier eyes approved
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seem to irritate my terrier's eyes and it's helpful when he has crusted nastiness. I still use a warm compress beforehand and make sure not to get the wipe solution into his eyes.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: too smalll, too thin
customer_reviews.text: I attempted to use this product two times on my golden retriever. The pads are simply too small and thin to be of any use. When washing her eyes I put on rubber gloves and getting a pad out of the bottle is nearly impossible. The actual pad is around two inches in diameter and this makes it too small to use. I disposed of the remainder of the bottle since it was useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: Tom M

customer_reviews.title: SAFETY CONCERN
customer_reviews.text: We received this product and the tamper seal was broken. We requested a replacement and the same thing happened again. Clearly and issue with manufacturing. Will not be using this product due to safety concerns. Returning both to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: JC900

customer_reviews.title: Has decreased crusty eyes on Cockapoo
customer_reviews.text: First time using this product to treat eyes on my Cockapoo. Her eyes get wet & crusty underneath. I used to use a wet soft cloth with warm water. She hated it! But I’ve found this product doesn’t bother her & it seems to have to actually decreased the problem. I don’t know how it works but it’s what I’ve been experiencing and I no longer have to use it everyday. So I’m very pleased with this product & will continue using it.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: It's all right, does the job
customer_reviews.text: Well looks like everyone were correct about inner seal of product. It was lifted off but appears to be done during shipping. Product was fresh and did not have any bad odor nor discoloration. Pads are pretty small and thin but works for my dogs just fine. Rust does not come off easy and does not help with preventing watering. I think I will go back to regular boogie wipes or baby wipes that can be used all over. Nothing to brag about.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: made it WORSE
customer_reviews.text: Made it worse! One of my cats gets weepy/gunky eyes from seasonal allergies, and I tried this on one eye only to see the difference. I'm really glad I only used on one, as when I woke up the next morning that eye was WAY more swollen and weepy! He could barely keep it open. I flushed with warm sterile water a couple times (which he obviously hated), and that seemed to help. The swelling went down by the end of the day, but I would definitely not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Great for my poodle
customer_reviews.text: My mini poodle, like many of them, has problems with goopy eyes. She loves for me to clean the gunk off and comes willingly to have it done. I imagine to her it's like a mother dog licking her to keep her clean. I have to do it daily. This is the opposite of having her teeth brushed which she runs and hides from. lol
customer_reviews.author: M. Strobbe

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Not overly impressed. Super thin pads that didn’t do much. I used them on my cat every day for a month and gave up. The photo is after a month and you can see there is still a large amount of buildup in each side of her nose. Found that unscented diaper wipes work easier and more effectively.
customer_reviews.author: L. Potter

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again...
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy again. Purchased only 6 months ago and it has some kind of mold growing in the lid of it. I haven’t even used but a few times and not stored anywhere humid. Very strange. If it were not past the return date, I would send these back.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Not inspected for previous use.
customer_reviews.text: This item came with the inner flap already opened and a dirt spot on the top pad. The fact that the product was not inspect before shipment is disturbing. I will never order this product from Amazon again and will be returning it tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: These are very good!
customer_reviews.text: I was using these for my dogs. Then I looked on the side and realized they are mostly boric acid. I remembered my Dad who was a chemist always had us use that to rinse our eyes and it is very gentle and thorough. I felt really good having these for my pups and knowing they are safe.
customer_reviews.author: Jacky

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Convenient and seems to really help reduce eye itchiness and irritation. I especially like that I can squeeze the excess liquid into her eyes before wiping them...that helps her dry eyes too.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn Barrett

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could say good things.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my Daddy's dog. Unfortunately, I made the mistake of trashing the return packaging & just taking it for granted these would be fine before I opened the actual container. I took them to his house and opened the container to find the seal was broken & the pads dried out.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica1177

customer_reviews.title: Miracle for sure.
customer_reviews.text: I have used prescription, used opticare. My yorkie would get such build up that there was pus underneath. I started using these twice a day and after a week his eyes look great. I squeeze the excess from the pad, which is thin and small, then I wipe gently under his eye multiple times and the build up comes loose and wipes away. I use a clean pad for the next eye. These make cleaning his eyes so easy.
customer_reviews.author: BR Mamma

customer_reviews.title: I think this is the best I have found
customer_reviews.text: Best eye cleaner I have found so far. I have a white Maltese and eye "crud" is just what you deal with, along with tear stains. And I really like it that the little pads kind of have a cleaning texture to them which makes it so much easier than a smooth one.
customer_reviews.author: Linda O.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My basset has runny eyes. He loves me to wipe them with these. They have helped more than meds. He apparently has allergies and the vet recommended Benadryl which makes him Dry groggy. Prefer soothing him with these wipes which we keep in the frig.
customer_reviews.author: Hudson

customer_reviews.title: It s a true miracle!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I get this item for my dogs. It works great on the three of them! I have a senior dog and two adult dogs. This works to prevent any eyes infection on your dogs. I will keep buying it again, since it has worked for my dogs fantastically!
customer_reviews.author: Alanis Sophia

customer_reviews.title: Eye spy no brown eyes
customer_reviews.text: These wipes work very well especially when I trim the extra hair from around her eyes. The instructions on the jar says to put some of the excess solution in the eyes. When I first did it, her eyes had reminded of characters from an anime but it didn't cause no negative reaction such as irritation, dry eyes, or vision problems. I have been using them for a year but I just now wrote a review for them. I would suggest giving them a try
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: This product works excellently and I highly recommend it for your pets
customer_reviews.text: This product works excellently and I highly recommend it for your pets. Be aware that the pads are very thin and you have to take the time to pry them apart to the individual pieces. But that just adds to the number of products in the jar. Really been helpful with my animals to keep eyes clean and fresh.
customer_reviews.author: M. Eileen Fawcett

customer_reviews.title: Problematic packaging
customer_reviews.text: The wipes are great! I get one on subscription every month. This months however, was sent in the same Box as my 30 lb bag of litter and the tub was crushed. The wipes were exposed and drying. The choice of packaging was inappropriate
customer_reviews.author: jen huskey

customer_reviews.title: Working for Us😊
customer_reviews.text: My dog suffers from dry eye. Her eyes produce thick stringy tears. Her eyes have to be cleaned and medicated twice per day. These are inexpensive enough. Get the job done and don't irritate her eyes.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rials

customer_reviews.title: Goo gone, Hot Dog!
customer_reviews.text: Worked well on white Maltipoo (or whatever he is) even on crusty parts. Better than trying to pry or cut stuff away. Yes, my dog doesn't like, but he doesn't like whatever I do around his eyes or feet or getting a bath-he runs when I get towels out!
customer_reviews.author: Herb

customer_reviews.title: My product was opened when I got it!
customer_reviews.text: My product was already opened when I got it! The pads were not very moist and did not work
customer_reviews.author: cacopeco

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 14 yr old malteste who gets tear stains and build up quite often. I used this product and almost instantly the build up wiped off and the stains were lesser. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann Good

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats with eye infections
customer_reviews.text: They are thin but very wet and my cat loves his eyes wiped. Does great job I would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Tara Burns

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my dog's eyes. I have a Maltese that sometimes has stuff in his eyes and these wipes remove it easily. They do not irritate his eyes or make them red at all. I also had to use these on one of my cats. He had something in his eye to the point where he could barely open it. I used one of these wipes and it cleared it up the next day. He just had debris in his eye from one of his toys, but this removed it right away. I would definitely recommend these if you are looking for something gentle and easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: The cotton pads are NOT that moist so the "product" is not working that well on my Maltese-Bichon's tear stains that are not even that bad. I have battled them for 6 years and thought these would be good for daily maintenance. Will not buy again. I already am doing daily (2 x day) wipe downs with baby wipes and filtered water that seems to work way better. Just my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa A.

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: My dog won't let me pour down his eyes, Like it says, he will freak out. So I've been putting on a paper towel and wiping, it works minimal at best, maybe if I did it 10x a day it would improve.
customer_reviews.author: B. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Miracle Care Eye Clear Sterile Eye Wash
customer_reviews.text: No complaints from my cat. He seems to enjoy having the area around his eyes cleaned, and they do a wonderful job of cleaning. I've even tried the eye pads on myself to make sure that they don't sting. Also, great price. You won't regret buying them.
customer_reviews.author: M. Piacenza

customer_reviews.title: Scary!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived today, a 2 pack in plastic bag which was wet. When opened 1 of the 2 plastic containers had it’s metallic seal pealed open 3/4 of the way-with wipes missing. The other plastic container was secure. Disturbing that a sterile container had been opened. Who opened it is the question.? Very expensive item that I was hoping would aid my doggie. Of course I threw out the opened plastic jar. Amazon should investigate who and where the vandalism occurred, was it the manufacturer or some person in Amazon. Scary!,, I am not asking for a refund but this is very concerning!
customer_reviews.author: Daniele

customer_reviews.title: He's happy with these eye wipes
customer_reviews.text: I use these daily to clean my senior dog's eyes. He doesn't seem bothered or irritated by them. They are very moist and easy to pull apart. The container is well sealed and keeps the eye wipes moist till the very last one.
customer_reviews.author: MissNancyMay

customer_reviews.title: Sadly it didn't work for my dog
customer_reviews.text: My 3year old white shitzu/maltese never had the red / brown tear stains until four months ago. I have bathed him, cleaned his eyes daily, tried vinegar and now this product- even cut out most of the reddish hair thinking it wouldn't come back. Nothing has worked. Not sure what brought the reddish tear stain on but it is all around his mouth and eyes and is quite unattractive for my once playful adorable baby. Any suggestions would be much appreciated!!!
customer_reviews.author: Adriano Cantreva

customer_reviews.title: MEH
customer_reviews.text: Probably fine for basic eye cleaning and if just basic staining. Our older dog has ongoing eye infection/reaction and can get pretty crusty daily. These do not work as well as other brands I have tried. Cheaper, but not as moist or maybe not enough of the solvent/soap to remove eye gunk and means we typically use twice as many pad and annoy our do more by needing to wipe more frequently and with more effort to remove or comb out.
customer_reviews.author: Dani K

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic product. My Yorkie will now let me clean her eyes. Before I used baby shampoo and had to wash and rinse. She hated it and it didn’t always work. These pads dissolve the hardened eye drainage like magic. My groomer will be so happy.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Burkey

customer_reviews.title: They're better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for two dogs with watery eyes due to allergies. The pads are more convenient than applying a liquid to a cotton ball, but they don't seem to do much to relieve the dogs' eye irritation, or clean the tear stains. They're better than nothing, but not a miracle product.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Pets with Runny Eyes
customer_reviews.text: My cat has FHV and these are great for when his eye is runny. It's like having a Persian cat but without the flat face. His eye will sometimes have the same stains a Persian cat has and these are gentle and he doesn't fight me.
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: works really well
customer_reviews.text: Found that our aussie poo wasn't bothered by the wetness and didn't fuss about it. Made it easier to wet the area and let it soak in for a few minutes and come back and it's easier to pull off the gunk and wipe it up.
customer_reviews.author: karasdad

customer_reviews.title: Just great, give a try
customer_reviews.text: It makes eyes cleaning so easy for my Bichon puppy. I try to use just cotton ball with luke warm water, but it takes me at least 5 minutes to clean, but this latterly takes me lesser than a minute to clean both. Love it, and will definitely re-buy.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy waste of money wont last! The container was not even full half way !
customer_reviews.author: Christy V

customer_reviews.title: Good for pets with dry eyes
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product for my dog who has dry eyes. I always need to take out the junk from her eyes throughout the day. I used to order another brand until it got discontinued. So I decided to give this one a shot. After using it and trying it out, it appears to work well and just fine. Softness level for sides of eyes are good. Wetness level is good too. Price is at a decent value compared to some others. Once ordered, I received the package really fast. I would buy these again and I do recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical, but since my dogs been on it, their tears/stains are dramatically reduced! Very pleased with the purchase. Will be getting more when the container's used up.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia R. Lamoreux

customer_reviews.title: This has done a great job in keeping them moist and less brown stain ...
customer_reviews.text: My dogs eyes get dry and I have to clean them a lot. This has done a great job in keeping them moist and less brown stain around their eyes. With air conditioning and fans in AZ things dry out a lot so I am glad to have this product. DJ
customer_reviews.author: D. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: too small
customer_reviews.text: the little pad is to small, hard to hold it and clean eye tears without it curling up so it doesn't really do a clean job
customer_reviews.author: CFP

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love how convenient and easy these are, but the price is high considering how many uses you can get out of a bottle of eyewash and some cotton balls or pads (usually over 100). For those who need on the go, or who just want one product in one place and don't want to worry about spilling or whatnot, these really do the job. Each one is really thin, so when you think you're pulling one out, double check and make sure that you're really getting one; the first few uses I wasted a lot, grabbing 4-5 at a time and thinking I was only getting one.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Don’t overuse
customer_reviews.text: I am re-ordering this product planning to use it occasionally, when I used it twice a day it made one of my pets Eye area inflamed I found that eliminating chicken from my puppies diet helped cure the tear stain
customer_reviews.author: Glennis C. DuBose

customer_reviews.title: Works extremely well
customer_reviews.text: Product delivered results in 2 weeks for our 5 lb poodle Taz who is 10 years old. Product removed film on eyes which I did not think would penetrate. Used min 2x per day up to 3x per day. Now doing maintenance 2x a day 3 days a week. Reordering 2 tubes for first time today. I’m amazed with product and don’t understand why vets dont recommend...maybe because they don’t make $$
customer_reviews.author: Randall flack

customer_reviews.title: Mine came opened like someone used it before me.
customer_reviews.text: Mine were NOT sterile in the least, it came almost with the lid off and with the foil opened. Not only that but the pads are thin and I refused to use them after it came opened.
customer_reviews.author: Dodginton

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: These work great! My pup gets hard eye crusts constantly and these wipes definitely help! Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not thick enough
customer_reviews.text: I wish the pads were thicker. Its hard to peel off the paper-thin circles and I usually end up getting too many which makes me feel I'm being wasteful.
customer_reviews.author: DL S.

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: I use these on one of my yorkies as his eyes tear up. The work well to soften any build up of crusty debris. Not sure if they work for staining as his coat is very dark in around his eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Kipper

customer_reviews.title: My jerk cat won't let me get near him with these...
customer_reviews.text: These are fine, but the sterile smell alerts my cat that I am up to no good and he bolts anytime I get one out. More my cat's fault that the product, but he can smell them a mile away and it is totally impossible to get near him with one in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: thatsnotmyname

customer_reviews.title: Purchased hoping it would help the tear stains for my ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased hoping it would help the tear stains for my malti-poo. It helps a little, but does not take them away. It does help in cleaning the area.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: No more goop
customer_reviews.text: I love that I don't have to rinse this out. Obviously no matter what I do my doggy hates it lol, but this is very easy to use. It really gets rid of all the goop under her eyes and her whiskers...Takes a few times sometimes but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoniac

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Superrrrr thin sheets, have to tease apart and the thinness does not help w handling them. You have to use multiple pads to get nice hick workable pad. Even then no difference.
customer_reviews.author: Ninjabetic

customer_reviews.title: Works well, excellent product
customer_reviews.text: It's not so much the product but the stream of mucus you cannot see due to their coat curly and way. The dried junk hides. The only draw back is the softness causes you to pull out many more than necessary
customer_reviews.author: Schmeg

customer_reviews.title: My kitten had started getting an eye infection but I ...
customer_reviews.text: My kitten had started getting an eye infection but I used these pads on her eye just one day & all gone!
customer_reviews.author: cyndi swanger

customer_reviews.title: Kind of work
customer_reviews.text: These pads are very small and thin, and didn't do a great job of cleaning my Maltese's eyes. I believe they might work if he had just been groomed and cleaned, and I used them every single day to prevent buildup. Otherwise they aren't the best, but they did remove a bit of tear staining.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Krebsbach

customer_reviews.title: Do not sale previously used items. It said new, and I assure you it is NOT!
customer_reviews.text: Clearly disappointed in this product. First of all I noticed it had been opened because the seal was broken. It said 90 pads...this is a half used container.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Meh....
customer_reviews.text: I don't think they are worth the money. These pads are soaked but you have to use more than two!
customer_reviews.author: TeriblteriTop Contributor: Pets

product_meta.title: Miracle Care Eye Clear Sterile Eye Wash
product_meta.description: Size:90 countEye Clear Pre-soaked pads, 90 count, by MiracleCorp/Gimborn are easy to use. Soothing formula helps eliminate tear stains for dogs, cats, birds and horses
feature_bullets: Also available in eye drop formula

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
